title: EastEnders spoilers: Jay rocked by shock death of Terry Bates tonight
text:
Jay Brown (Jamie Borthwick) is about to get a surprise blast from the past when his latest funeral client turns out to be Terry Bates – the criminal who was behind the death of his dad Jase. Viewers may remember that Jay lost his dad when he got into debt with Terry’s gang.

They turned up in Walford looking for him, trashing the Queen Vic in a terrifying siege in the process. During a final showdown, young Jay was forced to listen while hiding in another room as his father was beaten to death.

The storyline was raised again recently when Phil Mitchell (Steve McFadden) lied to Jay that his real father had been the homeless man who was killed in the car lot fire in the 90s. However, Max Branning (Jake Wood) later confirmed in a throwaway comment to Jay that he had pressured Phil into lying because…well, just because.

Advertisement

Advertisement

With the change to the plot reversed, Jay’s grief over losing Jase is revisited tonight when he is hit with demands for an elaborate and expensive funeral. But when he discovers that the person who is being laid to rest is violent Terry, his expression darkens.

Filled with hate for the man who killed his dad, Jay can’t stomach the thought of such a life being celebrated but he agrees to take on the custom. It soon becomes clear that he has ulterior motives with the funeral as he plots to expose Terry for the killer that he is.

A recent trailer saw Jay hitting the bottle and also looming over Terry’s body promising to reveal the horrible truth about the man he was.

But is Jay inviting danger to his door by crossing Terry’s associates at the upcoming funeral?

EastEnders continues on Tuesday 22nd October at 7:30pm on BBC One.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: He doesn't take the news well.
